messageBody:
--- sumitgupta_us <sumitgupta_us@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am looking for a solution, where I can generate
> reports for my
> dynamically loaded (through java program) Test
> Cases. Actually, I
> have written a java program that search for a
> particular directory
> (say TESTS) for Test Cases, and dynamically load
> them at runtime.
> Now, I am able to execute those Test Cases using
> JUnit Swing
> interface, but I want to generate Reports for them.
> Can anyone tell
> me, how it is possible?
>
> I have seen the ANT facility to generate the JUnit
> reports, but for
> that I need to write the names of the Test Cases in
> build.xml, which
> doesn't solve my purpose. I want to use some java
> APIs to generate
> those reports.
>
> Please Help.
>
> Sumit
>
>
>
Lookup the ant <batchtest> and <junitreport>.

I was using something like this:
<target name="run-test">
<junit printsummary="false"
errorProperty="test.failed"
failureProperty="test.failed">
<classpath>
<path refid="some.classpath"/>
</classpath>
<formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/>
<formatter type="xml" />
<batchtest fork="true" todir="${test.result}">
<fileset dir="${build.dir}"
includes="**/*Test.class"/>
</batchtest>
</junit>

<junitreport todir="${test.result}">
<fileset dir="${basedir}">
<include name="**/*TEST*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="noframes" todir="${test.result}"/>
</junitreport>

<fail message="Test failed - aborting build"
if="test.failed"/>
</target>
